item.title: Peloton 将裁员，预计 2026 年收入强劲；股价飙升
item.description: Peloton Interactive 预测 2026 年收入将高于预期，并表示将裁减 6% 的全球员工，以在持续的扭亏为盈努力中提高成本节约率，这使得这家健身自行车制造商的股价盘前上涨了近 23%。【原文：Peloton Interactive forecast 2026 revenue above estimates and said it would cut 6% of its global workforce to boost cost savings under an ongoing turnaround effort, sending the exercise-bike maker's shares up nearly 23% premarket.】

item.title: 由于需求下降，Froot Loops 生产商 WK Kellogg 公布的季度业绩不佳
item.description: WK Kellogg 周四公布的第二季度财报低于预期，受宏观经济不确定性导致包装早餐谷物需求疲软的影响。【原文：WK Kellogg reported second-quarter results below estimates on Thursday, hurt by soft demand for its packaged breakfast cereal amid macroeconomic uncertainty.】

item.title: 独家报道瑞波公司将以 2 亿美元收购稳定币平台 Rail
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普签署一项法律数周后，瑞波公司周四表示，将以 2 亿美元的价格收购稳定币支付平台 Rail。【原文：Ripple will buy stablecoin payments platform Rail for $200 million, the company said on Thursday, weeks after U.S. President Donald Trump signed a law that raised expectations cryptocurrency tokens are about to enter the mainstream.】

item.title: 医疗器械需求强劲，Zimmer Biomet 上调年度利润预期
item.description: 受髋关节和膝关节植入物需求加速的推动，Zimmer Biomet Holdings 周四上调了全年调整后利润预期，第二季度盈利超出预期。【原文：Zimmer Biomet Holdings raised its full-year adjusted profit forecast and beat second-quarter earnings expectations on Thursday, bolstered by accelerating demand for its hip and knee implants.】

item.title: 拉尔夫-劳伦因富裕购物者的需求而上调年度收入预期
item.description: 拉尔夫-劳伦（Ralph Lauren）周四上调了年度营收预期，表明北美、欧洲和亚洲富裕购物者对其 Polo 衬衫和电缆针织毛衣的需求强劲。【原文：Ralph Lauren raised its annual revenue forecast on Thursday, signaling robust demand from affluent shoppers for its Polo shirts and cable-knit sweaters in North America, Europe and Asia.】

item.title: 人工智能引领增长，预期上调提振投资者信心，Duolingo 大涨
item.description: Duolingo 周四收盘前股价大涨近 30%，原因是该公司上调了年度预期，增强了投资者对其通过人工智能功能和社交参与推动用户增长、同时提高货币化能力的信心。【原文：Duolingo shares surged nearly 30% before the bell on Thursday, after its annual forecast increase buoyed investor confidence in its ability to drive user growth through AI features and social engagement, while enhancing monetization.】

item.title: 德国电信与英伟达、布鲁克菲尔德合作建立人工智能数据中心 - 首席执行官
item.description: 德国电信（Deutsche Telekom）首席执行官周四表示，该公司正与英伟达（Nvidia）和加拿大私募股权基金布鲁克菲尔德（Brookfield）合作，争取在德国北莱茵-威斯特法伦州（North Rhine-Westphalia）建立欧盟人工智能 "千兆工厂 "之一。【原文：Deutsche Telekom is partnering with Nvidia and Canadian private equity fund Brookfield in a bid to build one of the EU's AI "gigafactories" in North Rhine-Westphalia, Germany, its chief executive said on Thursday.】

item.title: 特朗普要求英特尔首席执行官辞职
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普周四要求英特尔新任首席执行官陈立武立即辞职，称他与中国公司的关系受到质疑后 "高度矛盾"。【原文：President Donald Trump on Thursday called for the Intel new CEO Lip-Bu Tan to immediately resign, saying he is "highly conflicted" after questions arose about his ties to Chinese firms.】

item.title: 礼来减肥药数据令人失望，诺和诺德股价大涨
item.description: 在礼来公司实验性减肥药的试验数据低于预期后，诺和诺德公司的股票周四上涨了13.6%，增强了投资者对这家丹麦制药商市场领先的肥胖症治疗药物的信心。【原文：Shares in Novo Nordisk rose 13.6% on Thursday after trial data from Eli Lilly's experimental weight-loss pill fell short of expectations, boosting investor confidence in the Danish drugmaker's market-leading obesity treatment.】

item.title: Datadog 预测云安全应用增加，第三季度业绩乐观
item.description: 云安全公司Datadog周四预计第三季度营收将高于华尔街预期，这表明随着企业加大人工智能投资，对其服务的需求不断增长。【原文：Cloud security firm Datadog forecast third-quarter revenue above Wall Street estimates on Thursday, signaling growing demand for its services as enterprises ramp up investment in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 软件供应商 EPAM 因人工智能驱动的需求而上调年度预测
item.description: 由于企业继续大力投资人工智能技术，对其软件服务的需求强劲，EPAM Systems 周四上调了年度收入和利润预期。【原文：EPAM Systems raised its annual revenue and profit forecasts on Thursday, encouraged by strong demand for its software services as enterprises continue to invest heavily in artificial intelligence technologies.】

item.title: 康菲石油公司第二季度利润超出预期
item.description: 康菲石油公司（ConocoPhillips）周四公布的第二季度利润超过了华尔街的预期，因为产量的增加帮助这家石油和天然气生产商抵消了原油价格疲软带来的冲击。【原文：ConocoPhillips beat Wall Street estimates for second-quarter profit on Thursday, as a rise in output helped the oil and gas producer offset a hit from weak crude prices.】

item.title: 华纳兄弟发现公司的收入因流媒体业务扩张和票房大卖而激增
item.description: 周四，华纳兄弟探索公司（Warner Bros Discovery）的季度收入超过了华尔街的预期，这主要得益于 HBO Max 的国际扩张以及包括美国票房冠军《威廉与魔法》（A Minecraft Movie）在内的大片上映。【原文：Warner Bros Discovery topped Wall Street estimates for quarterly revenue on Thursday, boosted by the international expansion of HBO Max and blockbuster releases including U.S. top grosser "A Minecraft Movie."】

item.title: 被美国征收 50% 关税的巴西渔业寻求救命稻草
item.description: 美国周三对巴西大部分出口商品征收 50%的关税，巴西海产品行业正敲响警钟，向联邦政府施压，要求立即减免关税。【原文：Brazil's seafood industry is sounding the alarm to pressure the federal government for immediate relief as it grapples with mounting fears of job losses and bankruptcies as a result of the 50% tariffs the U.S. imposed on most Brazilian exports on Wednesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价关税冲击，苹果上涨
item.description: 当今美国和全球市场的重要事件【原文：What matters in U.S. and global markets today】

item.title: Kenvue在战略审查中实现预期利润
item.description: Kenvue 周四公布的第二季度利润基本符合华尔街的预期，与此同时，这家消费保健公司正在进行战略审查。【原文：Kenvue reported a second-quarter profit largely in line with Wall Street estimates on Thursday, amid a strategic review at the consumer health company.】

item.title: 减重药物发力，礼来上调全年盈利预期
item.description: 礼来（Eli Lilly）周四上调了全年利润预期，押注于其减肥特效药 Zepbound 需求的激增，因为该公司瞄准了新市场，并希望从诺和诺德（Novo Nordisk）的 Wegovy 手中抢夺更多份额。【原文：Eli Lilly raised its full-year profit forecast on Thursday, betting on surging demand for its blockbuster weight-loss drug, Zepbound, as it targets new markets and looks to grab more share from Novo Nordisk's Wegovy.】

item.title: Firefly Aerospace 将在今年美国最大的太空首次公开募股后首次亮相
item.description: Firefly Aerospace 公司将于本周四开始在纳斯达克上市交易，此前该公司在美国上市融资 8.683 亿美元，是今年美国最大的太空技术公司。【原文：Firefly Aerospace will begin trading on the Nasdaq on Thursday after raising $868.3 million in the largest U.S. listing this year by a space tech company.】

item.title: 关税豁免希望升温，科技股拉升华尔街期货价格
item.description: 美国股指期货周四上涨，预示着华尔街将出现新的涨势，因为有迹象表明，主要科技公司将避免美国总统唐纳德-特朗普对芯片进口征收最新关税。【原文：U.S. stock index futures rose on Thursday, pointing to fresh gains on Wall Street, on signs that major technology companies will avoid President Donald Trump's latest tariffs on chip imports.】

item.title: 新加坡吉宝集团为教育和数据中心资产募集 49 亿美元私人资金
item.description: 新加坡吉宝集团（Keppel）是一家全球资产管理和运营商，该公司周四表示，今年迄今已为其私人基金战略（包括教育资产和数据中心）获得 63 亿新元（49.1 亿美元）的管理资金。【原文：Singapore's Keppel has secured S$6.3 billion ($4.91 billion) in funds under management so far this year for its private fund strategies, including education assets and data centres, the global asset manager and operator said on Thursday.】

item.title: 消息人士称，美国贷款机构在关闭账户时考虑的是声誉规则而非政治因素
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士说，美国一些主要银行关闭账户的决定是基于有关声誉风险的规定，这回击了唐纳德-特朗普总统关于他和他的保守派支持者因政治原因而被拒绝提供服务的指责。【原文：Decisions by some major U.S. banks to close accounts were based on rules around reputational risk, people familiar with the matter said, pushing back on President Donald Trump's accusation that he and his conservative supporters were denied services for political reasons.】

item.title: 独家报道安哥拉债券反弹后从摩根大通取回2亿美元抵押品
item.description: 安哥拉财政部称，在其债券价格反弹、缓解了财政压力之后，安哥拉于5月取回了2亿美元抵押品，这些抵押品是安哥拉今年早些时候不得不向摩根大通提供的。【原文：Angola got back $200 million of collateral in May that it had to post to JPMorgan earlier in the year, the finance ministry said, after the price of its bond rebounded, easing pressure on its finances.】

item.title: 快餐需求改善，Restaurant Brands 季度销售额超出预期
item.description: 本周四，Restaurant Brands 的第二季度营收超过预期，原因是该公司的营销活动推动了美国和国际市场对汉堡王和其他品牌的需求。【原文：Restaurant Brands beat second-quarter revenue estimates on Thursday, as its marketing efforts drove demand at Burger King and other brands in the U.S. and international markets.】

item.title: 特朗普减免关税后，苹果引领全球科技股大涨
item.description: 在美国总统唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）发出最新的关税警告后，全球科技股周四出现了缓解性反弹，在很大程度上豁免了对芯片和半导体征收100%关税的威胁。【原文：Global technology stocks advanced on Thursday in a relief rally after the latest tariff salvo from U.S. President Donald Trump largely exempted industry heavyweights from his threat to impose 100% levy on chips and semiconductors.】

item.title: 美国牧场主慢慢开始重建锐减的牛群
item.description: 内布拉斯加州的牧场主克雷格-乌登（Craig Uden）在五月份的几周内多买了 200 头母牛和它们的孩子，以扩大他的牛群，因为干旱的天气让位于雨水，雨水使用于放牧的土地重新焕发生机。【原文：Nebraska cattle rancher Craig Uden bought 200 extra mother cows and their babies over a few weeks in May to expand his herd as dry weather gave way to rain that rejuvenated land used for grazing.】

item.title: 彭博新闻社报道：特朗普将签署命令，为 401(k) 另类资产开辟道路
item.description: 彭博新闻社周四援引一位熟悉该计划的人士的话报道称，美国总统唐纳德-特朗普将于周四签署一项行政命令，旨在允许私募股权、房地产、加密货币和其他另类资产参与 401（k）计划。【原文：U.S. President Donald Trump will sign an executive order on Thursday that aims to allow private equity, real estate, cryptocurrency and other alternative assets in 401(k)s, Bloomberg News reported on Thursday, citing a person familiar with the plans.】

item.title: 台湾调查 16 家中国企业挖走高科技人才
item.description: 台湾当局周四表示，他们正在调查 16 家涉嫌挖走半导体和其他高科技人才的中国公司，因为人们对技术外流的担忧与日俱增。【原文：Taiwan authorities said on Thursday they were investigating 16 Chinese companies for allegedly poaching semiconductor and other high-tech talent, amid growing concerns over technology outflows.】

item.title: Airbnb 下跌，因增长前景放缓再次引发对旅游需求放缓的担忧
item.description: 周四收盘前，Airbnb 的股价下跌了 6%，因为该公司预测今年下半年的增长将放缓，这让该行业的投资者感到失望，因为在主要旅游公司发布强劲的业绩展望后，他们预期旅游需求将出现反弹。【原文：Shares of Airbnb slumped 6% before the bell on Thursday after the company forecast slower growth in the second half of the year, disappointing investors of the sector expecting a rebound in travel demand after strong outlooks from major travel firms.】

item.title: 压力重重的美国低收入购物者寻找小包装、5 美元以下的餐厅餐饮
item.description: 宝洁公司、可口可乐公司和Chipotle Mexican Grill公司的高管们表示，由于美国对进口商品征收关税将进一步推高价格，美国低收入家庭正在减少外出就餐、旅游以及尿布、苏打水和啤酒等主食。【原文：Lower-income U.S. households are cutting back on eating out, travel and pantry staples like diapers, soda and beer, as U.S. tariffs on imports are set to push prices even higher, said executives from Procter & Gamble , Coca-Cola and Chipotle Mexican Grill .】

item.title: 陷入困境的美国医疗保健股经历了艰难的 2025 年，但吸引了一些低价猎手
item.description: 今年以来，美国医疗保健类股的困境进一步恶化，部分原因是特朗普政府的政策，但一些投资者打赌，这些被打压的股票现在正变得太便宜了，不能错过。【原文：Woes for U.S. healthcare stocks have worsened this year driven partly by Trump administration policies, although some investors are betting that the beaten-down shares are now becoming too much of a bargain to pass up.】
